So PanelGrid has layout https://primefaces.github.io/primefaces/8_0/#/components/panelgrid?id=responsive
Displays data in a 'tabular' layout, 'grid' layout or 'flex' layout. The grid and flex layout are responsive layouts. Default value is 'tabular'.
Why can't you just add the option "flex" to the layout instead of this new property?

nodes.bodyText:
Yep. I was the one who added layout="flex" to PanelGrid.
PanelGrid looks almost same in all three layout-modes. The difference is its html-rendering. html-table vs. div with grid-css-classes vs div with primeflex-css-class.
DataView is IMO a different thing.
http://primefaces.org/showcase/ui/data/dataview/paginator.xhtml
It has two layouts which look fundamental different. List and Grid.
You have a toggle switch.

In XHTML you do something like
<p:dataView>
   <p:dataViewGridItem>
     </p:dataViewGridItem>
     <p:dataViewListItem>
     </p:dataViewListItem>
</p:dataView>
Now we have two technical "flavours" of grid. But from an enduser-perspective it´s still the same grid.
From a somehow isolated perspective i´d like to deliver PrimeFlex as part of PrimeFaces. (Like Grid CSS comes with PrimeFaces) And just use internal PrimeFlex because it "does the right thing". And no need to offer Grid CSS and Prime Flex - modes . And bring PrimeFlex on your own into the project, ...
But i understand the arguments why this is a bad idea.
Maybe it´s better to introduce a new Context-Param which tells PrimeFaces to use PrimeFlex whereever it can instead of Grid CSS.
Or...
